Regarding past dharmas as past dharmas, giving rise to the notion of past dharmas, regarding future dharmas as future dharmas, giving rise to the notion of future dharmas, regarding present dharmas as present dharmas, giving rise to the notion of present dharmas.

If bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, when practicing the perfection of profound wisdom, have skillful means, they do not give rise to the notion of emptiness or non-emptiness regarding form, they do not give rise to the notion of emptiness or non-emptiness regarding feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness, and so on extensively, up to they do not give rise to the notion of emptiness or non-emptiness regarding omniscience, they do not give rise to the notion of emptiness or non-emptiness regarding the cognition of the path's characteristics or the cognition of all aspects;

'I can practice giving, this is the giving that is practiced, this is how giving is practiced;ğŸ”½I can uphold precepts, this is the precepts that are upheld, this is how precepts are upheld;

The Buddha told SubhÅ«ti:

At that time, SubhÅ«ti addressed the Buddha, saying:
How wondrous!
World-Honored One!
The nature of the profound Dharma is extremely rare. Whether it is explained or not, there is neither increase nor decrease.
The Buddha told SubhÅ«ti:ğŸ”½It is so!
It is so!
The nature of the profound Dharma is extremely rare. Whether it is explained or not, there is neither increase nor decrease.

It is just like space. Even if all Buddhas were to praise or disparage it for the duration of their lives, space would neither increase nor decrease. The nature of the profound Dharma is also like this. Whether it is explained or not, there is neither increase nor decrease.

Moreover, it is just like an illusory person. When praised or disparaged, they have no joy or sorrow, no increase or decrease. The nature of the profound Dharma is also like this. Whether it is explained or not, it is no different from the original.
The Venerable SubhÅ«ti again addressed the Buddha, saying:

World-Honored One!

World-Honored One!ğŸ”½If the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas don the armor of merit and diligently progress for the sake of sentient beings to bring them to maturity and liberation, it is as if they were donning the armor of merit and making diligent progress for the sake of space to bring it to maturity and liberation;

World-Honored One!

Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas attain the perfection of great vigor and make energetic progress towards unsurpassed perfect enlightenment in order to bring great benefits and joy to sentient beings who are like space.
World-Honored One!

Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas attain inconceivable and unequaled spiritual powers and make energetic progress towards unsurpassed perfect enlightenment in order to don the armor of merit for the ocean of dharmas' nature that is like space.
World-Honored One!
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas are the most courageous and valiant, and make energetic progress in order to don the armor of merit for the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment of buddhas who are like space.
World-Honored One!
The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas are extremely rare in diligently cultivating ascetic practices for the sake of all beings who are like space, wishing to realize unsurpassed perfect enlightenment!
Why is this?

Suppose the worlds in the trichiliocosm were filled with tathÄgatas, arhats, perfectly awakened ones, like bamboo, reeds, sugar cane, or other such thickets, remaining for an eon or the remainder of an eon, constantly teaching the true Dharma for the sake of all beings, each liberating innumerable and incalculable beings, causing them to enter nirvÄá¹‡a and ultimately attain peace and happiness, yet the realm of beings would neither increase nor decrease.

World-Honored One!

For this reason, I say that the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, for the sake of sentient beings who are like space, diligently cultivate ascetic practices, wishing to realize unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, which is extremely rare!

At that time, by the World-Honored One's majestic spiritual power, the entire great trichiliocosm, from the Heaven of the Four Kings up to the Heaven of the Sphere of Infinite Consciousness, all held heavenly sandalwood powder, which they scattered from afar towards the World-Honored One. They came to where the Buddha was, bowed their heads at his feet, and then withdrew to one side.

Chapter 3, Section 12: Praising Virtues, Part 3 At that time, Subhuti the Elder said to the Buddha:
World-Honored One!

If good men and good women are able to listen to, uphold, read, recite, diligently study, contemplate, write, explain, and widely disseminate this profound sutra of prajnaparamita, these good men and good women will have unimpaired faculties, complete limbs, bodies that do not age, and will not die an untimely death. They will always be respectfully surrounded and followed by innumerable hundreds of thousands of celestial beings who will guard them.
These good men and good women, on the eighth, fourteenth, and fifteenth days of each half-month, will read, recite, and expound this profound prajnaparamita.
